poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Two days at the kitchen table with Ushakov (Moscow, 1938), 4 vols, dark, Dark green cloth cover, I chewed At Pasternak ("Parsnip")'s early books of verse. Russian-English: brazier, brocade, Girt, adze, muzzles, sleepers, oven door, vitriol, Biscuit barrel, eagle owl, door curtain, abscess, Salt pans, Tatar tax collector, runrigs, ingot, Misfire, mapping pen, Adam's apple, alder, Weighman, buffalo, farthingale, meltwater, Catkin, fibril, crossbill, stilts, zinc white, Firebox, systole, crossbow - straight syntax, Strong, simple beat of a young heart, constant Fretting about the weather. Pagan Pilgrimage for me, who dug the lexical landscape More than the shiny CIA facsimile Of the legendary 60s Soviet edition. Still, The smart thing to do back then With your Dylan Albert Hall concert bootleg Was swap it for this and learn some Russian.
